result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Post-money valuation and VC ownership** You founded a firm three years ago. You started with $0.201 million, which gave you 1.946 million shares. You later sold 1.614 million shares to angel investors. Now, a VC firm wants to invest $5.338 million in exchange for 2.354 million new shares. ::: {.question-block}
1. What is the post-money valuation (in million)?
✅ Post-money = Total shares × Price per share = (5.91) × (2.27) = **13.411 million**
::: ::: {.question-block}
2. What percentage of the firm will the VC own?
✅ VC Ownership = 2.354 / (5.914) × 100 = **39.804%**
::: :::
